title: Senior Backend Developer - Node.js - TypeScript
description:
We are looking for a passionate **Backend Developer- Node.js, Typescript** who will design, develop, and maintain scalable, secure, and high-performing backend systems for a global company in **Gothenburg.**

**Start is ASAP, 1 year's contract to begin with, good possibility of extension after that.**

 **Skills and experience:**

* Proficiency in Node.js and TypeScript
* Experience with Azure or other cloud platforms
* Solid understanding of API design, data modeling, and REST/GraphQL integration
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines (Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, etc.)
* Knowledge of containerization (Docker) and version control (Git)
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Independence in task ownership and proactive communication
* Excellent communication (English) and interpersonal skills


This is a full-time consultant position through Incluso in **Gothenburg.** Start is ASAP, **1 year's contract** to begin with, good possibility of extension after that.


Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.


For more information about this role, please contact Kanika Singhal, recruiter at Incluso.

title: Javautvecklare till avancerade ledningssystem
description:
**Beskrivning**
---------------


Som Javautvecklare kliver du in i en verksamhet som utvecklar avancerade och verksamhetskritiska ledningssystem i en modern och tekniskt utmanande miljö. Du arbetar på plats i Luleå och blir en del av ett agilt utvecklingsteam där samarbete, kvalitet och kontinuerlig förbättring står i fokus. Rollen innebär att du bidrar till vidareutveckling, felsökning och optimering av komplexa system i en Linux-baserad miljö, med moderna verktyg och etablerade arbetssätt.

**Arbetsuppgifter**
-------------------


I rollen ansvarar du för att utveckla och vidareutveckla funktionalitet i Java och arbeta i en Linux-baserad utvecklingsmiljö. Du hanterar versionskontroll i GIT och använder Atlassian-verktyg för planering, dokumentation och samarbete tillsammans med teamet. Arbetet bedrivs enligt agila principer, där du deltar i sprintplanering, dagliga avstämningar och förbättringsinitiativ för att säkerställa hög kvalitet och stabil leverans. Du arbetar nära kollegor med olika kompetenser och bidrar aktivt till teamets gemensamma mål. Rollen innebär även att du deltar i felsökning och förbättrar befintliga lösningar för att stärka systemens tillförlitlighet och prestanda.

**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------

**Krav:**

* 4–8 års erfarenhet av Javautveckling
* Erfarenhet av Linux-utvecklingsmiljö
* God kunskap i GIT
* Erfarenhet av Atlassian-verktyg (t.ex. Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket)
* Erfarenhet av agil mjukvaruutveckling
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska
* Möjlighet att genomgå och godkännas enligt gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd
* Uppfyller eventuella krav på säkerhetsklass, inklusive krav på medborgarskap där det är tillämpligt

**Villkor**
-----------


Placeringsort för uppdraget är Luleå och arbetet sker på plats utan möjlighet till distansarbete. Tjänsten är på heltid (100 %) och avser perioden 2026-02-16 – 2026-08-14, med mycket goda möjligheter till förlängning. Arbetstider följer normala kontorstider om inget annat överenskoms.

**Om du är redo att ta dig an en roll inom Javautveckling och bidra med din kompetens och erfarenhet – tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan. Bifoga CV i din ansökan som tydligt visar att du har den kompetens och erfarenhet som efterfrågas för det aktuella arbetet. Vi rekryterar kontinuerligt och ser fram emot att höra från dig!**

**Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via e-post på grund av GDPR.**  

**För att din ansökan ska kunna behandlas ber vi dig därför att skicka in den via vår karriärsida**

title: iOS Developer
description:
### **Your New Role**


We are now looking for an experienced **iOS Developer** to join an exciting and fast-moving product organization in Gothenburg. In this role, you will work hands-on with iOS development and contribute to building high-quality, user-centric mobile solutions. You will take responsibility for design, implementation and continuous improvement of the app, and collaborate closely with product owners, designers and fellow developers. The environment is dynamic and entrepreneurial, which means you will have a strong influence on technical decisions, ways of working and product direction. This assignment is full-time and runs for approximately one year, with a high possibility of extension.

  

### **Good to Know**

**Scope of employment:** Full-time, 100%  

**Type of contract:** Fixed-term employment as a consultant via JobBusters  

**Working model:** Onsite in Gothenburg (office-first, 4:1 approach)  

**Salary:** According to agreement  

**Start date:** As soon as possible / according to agreement  

**End date:** 12 months, with possibility of extension  

**Application deadline:** 2025-12-03  

**In your application:** Ensure your CV clearly shows how you meet the required qualifications.

### **To succeed in this role, you will need:**


– At least 7–8 years of experience in iOS development  

– Strong skills in Swift and modern iOS frameworks  

– Experience working product-near in agile teams  

– A collaborative mindset, sense of responsibility and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment


### **What we Offer**


– Secure employment under collective agreement, including insurance and occupational pension  

– Wellness allowance and discounts via Benifex  

– Flex pension and access to Lifeplan advisory service  

– Additional parental leave compensation  

– Occupational health services  

– Long-term assignments and a dedicated Consultant Manager  

– Opportunities to build experience, expand your network and grow your career


### **We look forward to receiving your application**


Selections are made continuously, and the assignment may be filled before the deadline. No cover letter needed — please answer the screening questions in the application.

title: Konsultuppdrag | Native app-utvecklare
description:
**Endast frilans**

 **Rollbeskrivning**  

  

Vi söker en mycket erfaren native app-utvecklare som vill ta huvudansvar för att bygga vår kunds kommande mobilapp. Backend och API:er byggs av vårt team. Din roll blir att bygga själva appen från grunden, integrera all funktionalitet och säkerställa att allt fungerar stabilt, snabbt och användarvänligt.  

  

Vi letar efter någon som:

* Har djup erfarenhet av både iOS (Swift/SwiftUI) och Android (Kotlin/Jetpack Compose).
* Har byggt flera appar från grunden till lansering och underhåll.
* Är trygg med att skapa arkitektur, navigationsstruktur, datasynk, caching, pushnotiser och app-releaseprocesser.
* Kan ta ägarskap över appen och säkerställa att allt fungerar som det ska, även vid hög belastning.

  

Kort sagt: backend-teamet levererar API:erna. Du bygger appen utifrån design och ser till att hela upplevelsen håller absolut toppklass.  

  

De är ett litet team (cirka 10 utvecklare) med högt tempo som jobbar agilt på riktigt. Inga onödiga möten, inga långa beslutsvägar.  

  

  

  

De arbetar på plats en dag i veckan (tisdagar) på deras kontor i Stockholm och vid behov om arbetet kräver det. Resten av tiden är flexibel med arbete på distans.

 **Om oss**

*Senterprise är ett ledande rekryteringsbolag inom IT och en oberoende förmedlare av frilansande konsulter. Med aktiv headhunting, search och djup teknisk förståelse hjälper vi några av Sveriges främsta arbetsgivare att hitta rätt kandidater, både för anställning och konsultuppdrag.*

*Läs vidare på* *www.senterprise.se*

title: Fullstackutvecklare
description:
**Varför Komatsu Forest?**  

Vi kombinerar avancerade digitala lösningar med branschledande skogsmaskiner och molntjänster som **Smart Forestry**, vilket gör ditt arbete både tekniskt utmanande och meningsfullt. Hos oss kommer du att ha en nära koppling till verksamheten, våra maskiner och den miljö de används i – en unik chans att se dina lösningar användas i verkligheten. Som en del av vårt R&D-team med över 130 ingenjörer och specialister får du en kreativ arbetsmiljö där idéer blir verklighet och där du kan påverka hela utvecklingskedjan, från design till implementation och verifiering.  

  

**Ditt nya jobb**  

I rollen som **fullstackutvecklare** arbetar du i ett team som utvecklar och designar styrsystem och molnlösningar för våra maskiner. Du får en bred roll med inslag av:


* **Systemdesign och arkitektur** för vårt styrsystem
* **Utveckling av front- och** backend för våra olika applikationer
* **Integration och drift** av vår molnplattform SmartForestry

Teamet består av kunniga och engagerade kollegor som stöttar varandra och arbetar agilt i en modern kontorsmiljö med nära koppling till mjukvarulabb och övriga R&D-funktioner. Kika gärna närmare på vår arbetsplats här.

**Vem är du?**


För att lyckas i rollen har du:


* En akademisk examen inom datavetenskap eller interaktionsdesign, alternativt annan utbildning eller erfarenhet vi bedömer likvärdig
* 2+ års erfarenhet av front- och/eller backendprogrammering i C#/Java/Typescript
* Goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska
* Erfarenhet av REST API’s och datalager i någon form är en fördel men inget krav

Som person är du engagerad och trivs i en kreativ miljö där laganda, kvalitet och ständig utveckling står i fokus. Du är initiativtagande, analytisk och nyfiken, samtidigt som du har en stark samarbetsförmåga och bidrar till en god dynamik i teamet.


**Vad erbjuder vi?**


* Ett teamorienterat arbetssätt där vi stöttar och lär av varandra samt löser problem tillsammans
* Möjlighet att arbeta i en miljö där ständiga förbättringar & dina ambitioner och drivkrafter värdesätts
* En karriär med intressanta, meningsfulla och utmanande arbetsuppgifter i ett globalt företag som vet att mångfald bidrar till goda resultat och en bättre arbetsplats
* Trygghet och variation i en stor och stabil organisation med en lång historia – där du är med och skapar vår framtid


Till den här tjänsten ansöker du enkelt genom att endast bifoga ditt CV (eller ansluta med din LinkedIn-profil).
  

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**  

  



Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via vårt rekryteringsverktyg för att effektivisera och kvalitetssäkra rekryteringsarbetet. Alla dina uppgifter sparas i din profil och du kan enkelt logga in och uppdatera dina uppgifter när du vill. Fyll därför i dina uppgifter så omsorgsfullt som möjligt för att ge en rättvisande bild av dig själv. Uppgifterna behandlas och sparas enligt GDPR.

title: Azure Integration Developer / Integrationutvecklare
description:
*Epical är ett renodlat datakonsultföretag med tjänster och expertis som stöttar och möjliggör hantering, tillämpning och skydd av kunders data. Vi ser ansvarsfull användning av data som ett kraftfullt verktyg för att skapa positiv förändring i världen, och som hjälper oss att lösa några av de mest överhängande problemen för våra kunder och för samhället omkring oss. Vi är här för att skapa en framtid vi alla kan lita på.*

**Din roll som Azure Integration Developer**
--------------------------------------------

Som **Azure Integration Developer** på Epical kommer du att spela en central roll i att hjälpa våra kunder att lösa sina integrationsutmaningar. Du kommer att:

* **Designa och utveckla Azure-baserade integrationslösningar**: Använd Azure Logic Apps, Azure Functions, Azure API Management och andra Azure-tjänster för att skapa robusta, skalbara och säkra lösningar.
* **Ansvara för end-to-end leverans**: Ta ägarskap över integrationsprojekt från kravinsamling till driftsättning och underhåll.
* **Samarbeta och stötta tekniskt**: Arbeta nära kollegor, inklusive Integration Architects, för att säkerställa smidiga implementationer av komplexa lösningar.
* **Kontinuerligt lärande**: Hålla dig uppdaterad kring de senaste Azure-teknologierna och bidra till att förbättra våra utvecklingsprocesser.


Epical är på en spännande resa mot framtidens integration, där vi levererar förstklassiga lösningar på flera molnplattformar – med Microsoft Azure som vårt främsta fokusområde.


Vi tar oss an dynamiska och storskaliga projekt, vilket ger dig möjlighet att växa tillsammans med oss och utveckla din karriär inom vårt integrationscommunity.

**För att lyckas i rollen**
---------------------------


Vi tror att du känner igen dig i denna beskrivning:

* **Erfarenhet av Azure Integration Services**: Några års erfarenhet av Logic Apps, Functions, API Management eller liknande tjänster.
* **Stark grund inom systemintegration**: Praktisk erfarenhet av att designa och utveckla integrationslösningar.
* **Kunskap och DevOps**: Förståelse för CI/CD och DevOps-principer för effektiv utveckling.
* **Flytande svenska**: Då våra kunder består av bland annat svenska myndigheter är det viktigt att du talar svenska obehindrat.
* **Nyfikenhet och driv**: Ett genuint intresse för att hålla dig uppdaterad kring de senaste teknologierna.
* **Konsultativ förmåga:** Förmågan att bygga förtroende, förstå kundens verksamhet och omsätta komplexa behov till tydliga, värdeskapande lösningar.
* **Meriterande**: Erfarenhet av BizTalk eller bredare kompetens inom Azure-plattformen.
* **Meriterande**: Tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta som konsult är meriterande.

**Varför välja Epical?**
------------------------


Hos oss står tillit och samarbete i centrum. Som en del av vårt team kan du förvänta dig:

* **Balans mellan arbete och fritid**: Flexibla möjligheter till distansarbete och en kultur som värnar om ditt välmående.
* **Stimulerande uppdrag**: Spännande projekt med stora kunder i komplexa integrationsmiljöer.
* **Karriärmöjligheter**: Utveckla din roll och lär av några av de främsta experterna inom integration.
* **Attraktiva förmåner**: Konkurrenskraftig lön, utbildningar och certifieringar för att stärka din kompetens.
* **En värderingsdriven organisation**: Var med och skapa en rättvisare värld genom ansvarsfull användning av data och teknologi.

**Våra kärnvärden**
-------------------


Vi tror på att bygga en kultur där våra värderingar genomsyrar allt vi gör. De guidar oss i hur vi samarbetar, utvecklas och skapar värde för våra kunder.

* + **Accountability:** Vi tar ansvar för våra beslut och levererar med transparens och tillit.
	+ **Curiosity:** Vi drivs av nyfikenhet och mod att utforska nya möjligheter.
	+ **Empathy:** Vi skapar en inkluderande miljö där alla känner sig hörda och respekterade.
	+ **Empowerment:** Vi tror på att stärka varandra och skapa utrymme för utveckling och framgång.


Om du delar dessa värderingar tror vi att du kommer trivas och passa riktigt bra hos oss!


**Praktiska detaljer**
----------------------


Alla roller på Epical är tillsvidareanställningar med flexibilitet att arbeta hemifrån eller från något av våra kontor i **Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Västerås, Örebro eller Skövde**. För att kvalificera dig behöver du bo i Sverige och ha ett giltigt arbetstillstånd.

**Observera att vissa uppdrag kan kräva säkerhetsprövning i enlighet med den svenska säkerhetsskyddslagen.**


Låter detta som möjligheten du har väntat på? Då ser vi fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Systemutvecklare med inriktning .NET
description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens kollektivtrafiklösningar – på riktigt? Vi på Forsler & Stjerna söker en systemutvecklare inom .NET till ett långsiktigt och tekniskt spännande projekt där du får arbeta med nyutveckling, mikrotjänster och API: er.
  
Vad gör vi?
  
Forsler & Stjerna är Sveriges ledande mjukvaruutvecklare för planering av kollektivtrafik, skolskjuts och trafikinformation. Av våra produkter och tjänster har flera blivit branschstandard. Vi arbetar med alla Sveriges regioner som våra kunder, vilket ger oss en unik möjlighet att både förvalta kärnprodukter och driva innovation framåt.
  
Vi har vårt huvudkontor i Malmö och är 25 anställda. Vi är en del av Addnode Group med cirka 2 700 medarbetare, men verkar med det lilla bolagets hjärta och den stora koncernens trygghet.
  
Om rollen
  
Du kommer att arbeta i ett dedikerat team som moderniserar vår huvudprodukt Rebus – ett centralt system som används för att planera och samordna kollektivtrafik i hela Sverige. Vi går från desktopklient i VB.NET till en modulär, API-baserad lösning i .NET Core och C#. Du blir en viktig del i både omskrivningen av befintlig kod och utvecklingen av helt nya funktioner.
  
Vi söker nu två personer till teamet, båda med fokus på backendutveckling i modern .NET-miljö. Du kommer att få stort utrymme att bidra i tekniska diskussioner kring arkitektur, mikrotjänster, API-design.
  
Rollen är placerad på Forsler & Stjernas kontor i centrala Malmö. Vi erbjuder ett flexibelt upplägg där du kan arbeta på distans när det passar dig och teamet men vi ser gärna att du har möjlighet att komma in till kontoret med jämna mellanrum.
  
Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med inledande provanställning på sex månader. Önskad start är i oktober men vi är flexibla med hänsyn till uppsägningstid och tillgänglighet.
  
Är det här du?
  
  

**Vi söker dig som har:**  

Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling i .NET och C#
  
**Erfarenhet av att utveckla och arbeta med API:** er
  
Intresse för att arbeta med moderna arkitekturer och mikrotjänster
  
Förmåga att kommunicera obehindrat på svenska och engelska
  
  

**Det är meriterande om du också har erfarenhet av:**  

React/JavaScript
  
GIS, BI eller trafiksystem
  
SQL Server
  
CI/CD-pipelines
  
VB.NET (eftersom delar av den gamla miljön finns kvar ett tag till)
  
  

Vi tror att du är initiativtagande och trivs i en miljö där du får ta ansvar och påverka. Eftersom du i den här rollen kommer att arbeta med både omskrivning och nyutveckling av ett komplext och samhällskritiskt system, ställs krav på att du har förmåga att driva arbetet framåt – både självständigt och tillsammans med ditt team. Du är nyfiken, delar gärna med dig av din kunskap och uppskattar ett öppet klimat där idéer välkomnas. Vi ser också gärna att du är innovationsdriven – att du inte bara löser problem, utan också vågar ifrågasätta gamla lösningar och komma med nya perspektiv. Hos Forsler & Stjerna får du se konkret resultat av det du bygger – när kollektivtrafiken fungerar bättre märks det i människors vardag.
  
Därför ska du välja Forsler & Stjerna
  
  

**Hos oss får du:**  

Vara med i ett långsiktigt och strategiskt projekt
  
Påverka arkitektur, teknikval och arbetssätt
  
Arbeta i en platt organisation med familjär stämning och korta beslutsvägar
  
Vara en del av ett team med hög kompetens och blandad ålder – från 30 till 60+
  
Arbeta i en stabil bransch där kollektivtrafiken rullar även när konjunkturen svajar
  
  

**Vi erbjuder dessutom:**  

Träningstimme varje vecka (vilket innebär 39 timmars arbetsvecka)
  
5 000 kr i friskvård
  
Flexibilitet kring distansarbete
  
Årliga konferenser, julbord och sommarfester
  
  

Låter detta som en spännande utmaning? Kul, då ser vi fram emot din ansökan!
  
  

Systerbolaget Decerno hanterar delar av rekryteringsprocessen. Skicka in din ansökan till rekrytering@decerno.se
  
med ditt CV & gärna ett personligt brev. Urval sker löpande, så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan! Märk ansökan med Forsler & Stjerna Systemutvecklare .NET. Observera att återkoppling sker först efter sommaren när vi är tillbaka efter semesterperioden.
  
Genom att skicka in din ansökan samtycker du till att vi behandlar dina personuppgifter för rekryteringsändamål i enlighet med gällande dataskyddslagstiftning. Dina uppgifter kommer att hanteras konfidentiellt och sparas endast så länge det är nödvändigt för rekryteringsprocessen.

title: Senior systemutvecklare .NET
description:
**Är du en erfaren fullstackutvecklare med tidigare erfarenhet av offentliga verksamheter?**

  

Med en ökad efterfrågan på våra tjänster vill vi stärka vårt team i Luleå. Agio är specialiserade på att leverera effektiva och smarta IT-lösningar till våra kunder. Som en del av vårt team kommer du att ha möjlighet att arbeta med de senaste teknologierna och vara involverad i projekt som gör verklig samhällsskillnad.


I dina uppdrag kommer du att jobba i stora omställningsprojekt hos våra kunder inom offentlig sektor där vi söker dig som har flerårig erfarenhet av .NET-utveckling.

 **För att lyckas i din roll som konsult på Agio ska du ha erfarenhet inom:**

* utveckling av .NET-baserade applikationer och lösningar
* nyttja AI i ditt arbete
* Språk: C#, HTML, CSS, JavaScript
* Ramverk: .NET, .Net Core, ASP.NET
* Databaser: Microsoft SQL-server
* DevOps CI/CD
* Webbapplikationer: Windows Server, IIS
* Arkitektur: Mikrotjänstarkitektur
* Utveckling i moderna frontendramverk såsom Blazor, Vue och React.


Du kommer att arbeta tätt tillsammans med andra utvecklare, tekniska experter, testare och projektledare för att säkerställa hög kvalitet och leverans i tid. På Agio kommer du att tillhöra ett team som finns representerat på varje kontor.

*Vi söker dig som*

* har akademisk utbildning inom Systemvetenskap/Datavetenskap eller motsvarande
* har minst 5 års erfarenhet av systemutveckling inom .NET samt andra relevanta tekniker och ramverk
* erfarenhet av Azure DevOps, CI/CD
* erfarenhet av utvecklingsprojekt i offentliga verksamheter
* har erfarenhet av att arbeta agilt i team med god förmåga att kommunicera med kollegor, kunder och andra intressenter
* behärskar det svenska språket i tal och skrift
* har ett genuint intresse för hur AI och automation kan effektivisera verksamheter samt vilket värde det kan skapa.

**Om Agio**


Agio grundades 2003 i Luleå. Vi har genom åren byggt upp ett stabilt och välmående bolag med en kundcentrerad kultur, vilket har resulterat i långvariga kundrelationer och samarbeten. Vi erbjuder intressanta uppdrag med samhällsnyttiga tillämpningar och en trygg anställning med kollektivavtal — vi tar ansvar för att tillsammans skapa en framgångsrik arbetsplats.

**Vi erbjuder dig**

  

* uppdrag med samhällsnyttiga tillämpningar
* en anställning på ett företag med stabila kundrelationer och samarbeten
* en arbetsplats som värnar om din balans i livet
* en kompetensresa som är unik för dig och din karriärresa
* en trygg anställning med kollektivavtal och fina förmåner
* en platt organisation med närhet till ledning och stor delaktighet

**Vill du jobba hos oss?**  

Skicka in en ansökan genom att svara några korta frågor nedan. Ansökningar via e-post kommer att hänvisas hit. Skicka in din ansökan senast den 31 januari 2026. Urval kommer ske löpande, så vänta inte med din ansökan!
company_description: Agio is a hybrid cybersecurity and managed IT organization equipping financial services with next generation cyber protection and technology support.

title: Node.js Developer
description:
**We are looking for a Backend Developer in Stockholm with immediate start!** 




  





**About the role** 




 We are looking for a Node.js Developer to join our team in Stockholm. You will be working directly with our customers in dynamic and engaging projects. It is a great opportunity for a long term cooperation.
 



  





**About Provide IT** 




 Provide IT is an IT company with a long history. Our team works in a hybrid model from offices in Gothenburg and Stockholm. We focus on two business areas, consulting and digital agency. Provide IT has a great company culture that is key for our employees. We also do a lot of team building activities.
 



  






 Join us and see for yourself!
 




  





**Ideal profile** 



* 5+ years of experience.
* Proficient in Node.js
* Containers and cloud deployment (Docker, Kubernetes)
* Experience with Server-side rendering (SSR) and static site generation (SSG)
* Knowledge of Next.js and Java considered a big plus
* Computer Science degree preferred.
* Swedish fluency is a plus



  





 Hope to hear from you!

title: Backend Engineer | AI Engineer | AI Agent Developer
description:
**Company Description**
 We are a consulting company with a bunch of tech-savvy and happy people!
   

  

 We love technology, we love design, and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where every individual is highly valued.
   

  

 With us, everyone can be themselves while respecting others for who they are. We believe that when an amazing mix of people come together and share their knowledge, experiences, and ideas, we can help our clients on a completely different level.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who can start immediately and wants to grow with us!
   

  

 With us, you have great opportunities to make real progress in your career and the chance to take on significant responsibility.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As part of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) squad, you will play a key role in our “AI Momentum” strategy, integrating cutting-edge AI tools with our IAM landscape to enhance security and authorization controls. This includes building MCP Gateway integrations with SSO platforms and driving projects related to employee identity access management. You will also contribute to making AI Agents first-class citizens within our IAM environment and help upskill IT teams in AI fluency through knowledge-sharing sessions.
   

  

**What You’ll Do:**
* Collaborate closely with engineers, product designers, and product owners to evolve our Identity Management landscape towards an AI-first approach, keeping security as the guiding principle.
* Identify potential risks introduced by AI-enabled third-party tools integrated into our collaborative tooling suite and develop solutions to mitigate these risks.
* Take operational responsibility for the components you develop, ensuring reliability and maintainability.


 Qualifications
   

  

* Experienced in designing, building, testing, debugging, and optimizing code for agentic systems, MCP servers, and modern AI tools.
* Experienced in designing, building, testing, debugging, and optimizing code for identity authentication and authorization integrations using standard protocols such as SAML, OIDC, and OAuth 2.0.
* Skilled in Java and Go (preferred).
* Thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced environment where learning, experimentation, and iteration are encouraged.


 Additional Information
   

  

**Start date:** 
 ASAP
   

  

**Mode of Work:** 
 Flexible remote-first setup with a distributed team across Europe and the US.
   

  

**Location:** 
 UK or Sweden based.
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment.
   

  

 We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.

title: Mobile Developer
description:
**Job Description**

**WHAT YOU’LL DO​**




 As a Mobile Developer, you'll ensure seamless and engaging experiences across smartphones, PCs, and other devices. Experience with multiple device types, payments, and iOS is highly valued. While Kotlin is the main language, JavaScript and TypeScript are also useful. Your work will cover POS sales, payments, back-office applications, mobile payments, self-checkout stations, and standout in-store payment solutions.
   

  





**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH**




 At Store Lens, we work closely with Portfolio Brands and H&M Brand to design and provide technical solutions. We contribute to product development at every stage, from setting requirements to rollout and testing. From day one, we focus on improving by listening, building, and refining as we go. Even as we define requirements, we are already thinking ahead, using early designs, first developments, and new learnings to continuously make the product better.
   

  





 We are curious, active listeners and hands-on doers.
   

  





 Beyond your work with Store Lens, you will also be part of our Engineering community, where you will have access to a network of experts, resources, and opportunities to grow.
   

  





**WHO YOU ARE​**




 We are looking for people with…​
   

  




* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience), and at least 5-8 years of experience as a Software Engineer with mobile and front end focus.
* Proficiency in Android development in Kotlin.
* Proficiency in build secure applications with Microsoft Login and Single Sign-On capabilities.
* Experience in mobile development for multiple devices.
* Experience Integrate hardware and communicate effectively with Android applications.
* Experience to work with SDKs from external vendors.
* Experience in Consume web services (e.g., REST APIs).
* Collaborate with UX/UI designers and utilize Figma for design implementation.
* Experience of CI/ CD pipelines using Azure DevOps / GitHub Actions.
* Knowledge and apply basic Mobile Device Management (MDM) principles (e.g., Airwatch).
* Experience in POS, Payment and Checkout area is a plus.
* IOS development, experience is a plus.
* Apply basic web development skills is a plus.



*And people who have* 
 :
   

  




* Continuous learning mindset to stay updated on emerging trends and technologies in backend testing.
* Ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment and communicate technical concepts clearly.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Experience conducting code reviews, identifying areas of improvement, and provide constructive feedback to maintain code quality and consistency.
* Familiarity in backend testing with a focus on ensuring the reliability and performance of backend systems.
* Familiarity with Agile/Scrum development methodologies.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


**Additional Information**

**WHO WE ARE** 
 ​
   

  





 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.​
   

  





 ​We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. ​
   

  





**​WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE** 
 ​
   

  





 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  





 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  





**JOIN US​** 
  

  





 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.​
   

  





 ​Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.​
   

  





 ​
 *\*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.​*

title: Fullstack Engineer - Integrations Team
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 Mentimeter serves hundreds of millions of users with services that we deploy roughly 40 times a week. With transaction loads up to hundreds of votes per second, we have to be sure we can scale while still delivering a fast and smooth experience.
   

  

 We work in small, independent, cross-functional and self-organizing teams. The team’s product manager and the team work together to organize and plan the team’s backlog with a focus on continuously delivering value to our users.
   

  

 Please note that we are an English-first company, meaning you don’t have to know Swedish to work here. Make sure your application and relevant documents are in English.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 You'll be joining our Workplace Integrations team - a newly formed team focused on building the bridges that make Mentimeter indispensable within existing workplace ecosystems. We enable strategic integrations with platforms like Microsoft Teams, and Google Workspace that unlock value for both end users and enterprises, turning every integration into an opportunity for organizational growth.
   

  

 On the Workplace Integrations team specifically, you'll design and build scalable integration architectures connecting Mentimeter with integrations that are the fabric of how companies operate. You'll ensure our integrations meet enterprise requirements for security, compliance, and reliability, while building monitoring systems to maintain high availability. You'll also create developer-friendly documentation and balance technical decisions that serve both immediate user needs and long-term scalability.
   

  

 As a member of the team you’ll contribute to strategic decisions about future integrations - building deep domain knowledge about the workplace ecosystem and contributing insights on which platforms will drive the most value for our users and business. You will do this with other engineers, a Product Manager, a Product Designer, and an Engineering Manager. Even though there are some specific roles in the team, we do things and solve problems together. We want you to be someone who engages with the rest of the team in product and design decisions and doesn't shy away from discussions.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You are a reliable, high-performing individual contributor with a solid understanding of your area of specialization. You always have a good idea of what you want to do and then just do it. You embrace change and short feedback loops.
   

  

 In addition to living up to our cultural values (see our
 **Culture at Mentimeter** 
 section below), we hope you bring a passion for software development, scalable architecture, and building great products. For us, it is important that everyone cares about code quality, so an interest in testing and automation is needed. Excellent communication skills and working independently and in a team are other traits we are looking for in all our colleagues.
   

  

 For the Workplace Integrations team, experience building integrations with third-party platforms or working extensively with external APIs is valuable. You should understand the complexities of distributed systems and async workflows, feel comfortable navigating technical documentation from various vendors, and have a security-first mindset, especially in enterprise contexts. You can balance perfectionism with pragmatism and are excited by making complex technical systems feel simple to end users.
   

  

 Last but not least, you must have a curious mindset, be open to learning & sharing knowledge, and be interested in working with our tech stack.
   

  

**The actual coding**
 The Tech Stack At Mentimeter Consists Of a Frontend Written In React (Next.js And Typescript), And a Backend Written In Ruby (not Rails). Supported By Some Of The Following Technologies
   

  

* Tailwind CSS
* Node.js
* Redis
* PostgreSQL
* Cloudflare
* AWS


 On the Workplace Integrations team, you'll also work with various third-party APIs and SDKs (Microsoft Graph, Slack, Google Workspace), OAuth 2.0 and other authentication protocols, webhook systems and event-driven architectures, and message queues for reliable async processing.
   

  

 We require someone who knows React well but not necessarily Ruby for this role. If you know Ruby, that's great, but knowing another backend language well and being willing to learn Ruby is equally fine. It's more important to us that you have the right attitude than the exact right skill set.
   

  

**Our Recruitment Process**
* Introduction call


 Get to know us better and introduce yourself further.
   

  

* Meet the hiring manager


 Get to know the team scope and role expectations
   

  

* Culture interview


 Discuss our company culture and core values
   

  

* Technical competence interview


 Show your skills by conducting a technical system design case with other engineers onsite.
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Data Warehouse Developer
description:
* Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform.
* Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.
* Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.
* Be a productive member of the team.


 Requirements
   

  

* Minimum 6 years of experience in Data warehouse development, Cloud technologies, SQL development, working with CI/CD pipelines
* Minimum 1 year of experience in Python development and working within SAFe or another Agile framework
* Experienced and technically strong Data Warehouse Developer to support the development of our cloud-based information provisioning platform, YoDA, built on Azure and Snowflake.
* Play a key role in designing and developing database solutions aligned with Data Vault principles and leveraging the cloud-based DataOps tool ADE, the work is executed within the SAFe Agile framework.
* Design and develop data warehouse components following Data Vault methodologies.
* Build robust SQL-based data models and transformation logic.
* Work with cloud technologies such as Snowflake, Azure Data Lake, and Azure Data Factory.
* Contribute to CI/CD pipeline development and automation.
* Support continuous improvement by staying updated with emerging technologies.
* Collaborate closely with team members while sharing knowledge and supporting skill development across the organization.
* Deliver solutions that emphasize creativity, quality, and customer value.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent professional experience.
* Strong interest in modern data technologies and a proactive, engaged approach to development.
* Good understanding of Snowflake
* Familiarity with SAFe methodology


 Benefits
   

  

* A challenging, innovating environment.
* Opportunities for learning where needed.

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
**Expleo** 
 is seeking a highly skilled and experienced
 **Fullstack Developer** 
 to join our team in
 **Sweden** 
 (located in Gothenburg OR Stockholm).
   

  

 Our
 **ideal** 
 candidate has an always-on mindset with a strong background in designing, configuring, and managing solutions for devices, tools, and applications in a factory/corporate setting.
   

  

 If you are a full-stack engineer looking to expand your skill set, we'd love to hear from you. Join our team today and take the next step in your career!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Understand and reflect on the customer needs to bring value to the organization.
* Take part in the development cycle using innovative technologies and frameworks.
* Secure qualitative, efficient and performance deliveries.
* Provide input for the design and construction of test cases and scenarios and help validate executed test results.
* Contribute to boosting the team to continually increase knowledge, competence, performance, and innovation
* Collaborate with suppliers, architects, engineers, developers, and internal stakeholders on upcoming and innovative technologies and standardization.
* Collaborate with the local IT site teams for problem/opportunity analysis.


**Qualifications**
* Hold a bachelor’s degree in information technology, Computer Science or equivalent experience in a relevant field.
* Knowledge and experience in agile development practices, ITIL (incident, problem & change process), collaboration tools (such as Azure DevOps or similar)
* Java development & support, relational databases (Oracle, SQL server, My SQL).
* Eager to learn and grow (yourself and the company) using a modern approach to Software Engineering.
* Ability to work under rapidly changing conditions and have the capability to identify, mitigate and decide on solutions when facing obstacles.
* You are fluent in English, both verbally and written.
* You should have a general understanding of production processes and understand how all these things work together to make end user applications work well.
* Knowledge of the automotive industry is meritorious.


**Experience**
* Knowledge about databases (MS SQL (Azure))
* Development platforms (Java, OpenShift, ...)
* Azure Cloud (App services, AKS Azure Kubernetes Cluster)
* SQL server for database
* Azure Storage, Azure Container Services
* Frameworks (Spring, Springboot, WebFlux, ...)
* Messaging (MQ, Kafka, REST API, ...)
* Front-end (Angular)
* Test Driven Development (Unit testing in Spring Boot and Angular, in memory database testing using Mockito)
* Agile processes (Safe / Scrum / ADO) but also about backlog management, strategic planning, business relationship management, problem analysis and business modelling.
* Bonus points for having relevant experience using docker containers and orchestration with Kubernetes.


**Benefits**
**Who are we?**
 Expleo is a rapidly growing consulting company dedicated to delivering innovative solutions in the fields of AI engineering, digitalization, hyper-automation, cybersecurity, and data science. With a strong commitment to integrity, diversity, sustainability, and societal security, Expleo is at the forefront of creating a better future. Join our dynamic team and be part of our journey to shape the future of technology and business.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
* Collaborative working environment – we stand shoulder to shoulder with our clients and our peers through good times and challenges
* We empower all passionate technology loving professionals by allowing them to expand their skills and take part in inspiring projects
* Expleo Academy - enables you to acquire and develop the right skills by delivering a suite of accredited training courses
* Always working as one team, our people are not afraid to think big and challenge the status quo
* Collective agreement with the union
* Access to a collection of benefits and discounted prices on services and shops.
* Health benefits
* Expleo team activities


 "We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age ”.

title: Fullstack Developer Java/Kotlin/React
description:
We are looking for a full-stack developer who believes deeply in modern engineering principles and wants to help build a truly digital, domain-driven organization.
 



 You will design, develop, and maintain software products and microservices that enable our business domains to operate efficiently and innovate quickly.
 



  
 



 You will work closely with domain experts and other developers to understand real business workflows and translate them into scalable, reliable digital solutions. You will also ensure healthy engineering practices across your team, such as code quality, testing, and DevSecOps-minded ways of working.
 


 Main Responsibilities:
 
 Key duties include:
 


* Design, develop, and operate backend and frontend solutions central to the client’s digital ecosystem.
* Build user-facing features and applications using modern full-stack approaches.
* Ensure the services your team owns are fast, scalable, secure, and observable.
* Collaborate with domain experts to understand business needs and translate them into technical solutions.
* Contribute to a healthy engineering culture, including automated testing, continuous delivery, and documentation.
* Work closely with other development teams, product teams, and domain stakeholders to deliver valuable and maintainable solutions.


 Key Requirements:
 * Proficient in Java, Kotlin, Spring Boot, and React.
* Proven experience in full-stack development.
* Strong understanding of software engineering principles.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
* Experience with DevSecOps methodologies.
* Skills in automated testing and continuous integration/delivery.

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
We're Sweden’s largest app and marketplace for booking beauty and health services. As a SaaS-enabeled company offering industry leading software we have more than 14,000 connected specialists across the country, we make almost all of Sweden’s salons and clinics bookable in one place — including hairdressers, massage therapists, podiatrists, beauty salons, chiropractors, and many more.
 



  





 At bokadirekt.se, consumers can search, book, and pay for treatments and services with just a few clicks. Every month, over 5 million consumers visit our platform, and nearly 2 million bookings are made through our website and apps.Bokadirekt is growing fast and currently employs over 100 people with offices in Stockholm and Luleå.
 



  





**What we are looking for** 




 A driven and experienced Fullstack Developer to join our growing tech team at Bokadirekt — Sweden’s leading platform for online bookings and payments within beauty and health.
 



 In this role, you’ll work primarily on our business system — the platform that helps thousands of merchants across Sweden manage their bookings, process payments, and run their salons efficiently. You’ll also contribute to our journal system, which enables professionals to securely manage and document client interactions and treatment history. You’ll play a key role in building features that empower businesses and make their everyday work smoother, faster, and more intuitive.
 



  





 Our platform handles millions of bookings every month, and we’re continuously evolving — improving scalability, enhancing the user experience, and integrating smarter technologies. You’ll work closely with product managers and designers to create elegant, effective solutions that make a tangible difference for both merchants and consumers.
 



  





 We’re also investing heavily in AI and automation, using data and intelligence to personalize experiences and simplify administration — and you’ll have the opportunity to be part of that journey.
 



  





**What You'll Do** 




 As a Fullstack Developer, you’ll take ownership of the full development process — from architecture and technical implementation to quality assurance. You’ll work across our .NET backend, Angular frontend, and SQL Server databases, helping us deliver reliable, scalable, and high-performing systems that power a platform used by millions.
 



  





 There’s also an opportunity to work with or learn React Native, contributing to the development of our Bokadirekt Business app, used daily by thousands of professionals.
 


* Develop and maintain our core platform built with .NET and Angular
* Work with SQL Server to design and optimize database structures
* Contribute to technical design and architecture decisions
* Collaborate closely with product owners, UX designers, and other developers
* Continuously improve code quality, performance, and delivery processes



  





**Who you are** 



* 5+ years of experience working as a fullstack developer
* Solid experience with .NET (C#) and Angular
* Strong skills in SQL Server and database development
* Experience working in an agile team environment
* A proactive mindset — you’re driven, accountable, and delivery-focused
* Fluent in Swedish is preferred



  





**Bonus points** 



* Azure or other cloud platforms
* CI/CD pipelines and DevOps principles
* Microservices architecture
* Journal systems



  





**What We Offer** 



* The chance to influence our architecture, tech stack, and product direction
* A culture built on collaboration, ownership, and innovation
* Flexible working hours and a hybrid work setup
* Modern office space in central Stockholm
* Competitive salary and benefits package



  





**About the role** 




 Start date: As soon as possible
 



 Location: Central Stockholm (Hybrid)
 



 Employment Type: Full-time, Permanent
 



  





**Application** 




 Send in your resume as soon as possible, we are eager to get to know you. Last day to apply is 8th of December.
 



  





 We look forward hearing from you!

title: Fullstack .NET Developer – Mobility
description:
**Would you like to help shape digital insurance experiences for nearly a million customers across the Nordics?** 




  





 Help us transform the way people and businesses manage car insurance. By harnessing the power of cloud technology and customer-focused platforms, we’re creating smarter, more seamless experiences. We’re looking for a talented full-stack developer to join our cross-functional team and collaborate on innovative solutions.
 



  





**About The Role** 




 As a full-stack developer, you’ll join our Branded Services team and collaborate with skilled professionals to build white-label self-service portals for our partners, which include nearly all major car brands. These platforms enable individuals and businesses to manage car insurance policies, submit claims, review payments, and more, serving a primarily Swedish customer base.
 



  





**We offer** 




 In the same way that we place high demands on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer.
 



 Here are some of the benefits of working at If:
 


* An including work environment where everyone is welcome
* Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
* Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
* Possibility of hybrid workplace
* Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
* Great insurance benefits
* Lunch benefit
* High pension savings



  





**About The Team** 




 The Branded Services team is a cross-functional group with all the competencies needed to deliver complete, end-to-end solutions. We are committed to creating intuitive, customer-facing platforms that make managing car insurance simple and efficient. Our team embraces agile methodologies and thrives on collaboration, ensuring every member plays an active role in shaping meaningful products.
 



  





 You’ll join a distributed team primarily located in Gothenburg, Stockholm, and Riga, working closely with development groups across the Baltics and Scandinavia. Together, we focus on building solutions that truly meet real customer needs. We value enthusiasm for agile development and a proactive, team-oriented approach. Confidence in mentoring others and supporting their growth is equally important to us.
 



  





**Who are you?** 



* You enjoy working closely with others, sharing ideas, and learning from different perspectives.
* You take responsibility for your work and feel proud of delivering high-quality results.
* You’re curious, eager to grow, and open to exploring new technologies and ways of working.
* You care about creating simple, intuitive, and valuable experiences for users.



  





**You also have:** 




*Essential skills:* 



* Full-stack development skills with .NET technologies
* Experience with cloud applications (e.g., Azure, AWS, GCP)
* Solid understanding of HTML, CSS, and front-end fundamentals
* REST and/or SOAP integrations (building and consuming)



  





*Additional skills:* 



* Experience with web content CMS platforms (e.g., Optimizely)
* Familiarity with Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment tools (e.g., Azure DevOps, TeamCity, Jenkins)
* Proficiency with Git, including pull requests and code reviews
* Experience with SQL Server and Entity Framework (or similar ORM tools)
* Familiarity with GitHub Copilot or similar AI development assistants
* Professional proficiency in Swedish, but you do not need to be a native speaker



  





**Additional Facts And The Recruitment Process** 




**Application deadline:** 
 Screening and interviewing will be conducted on a rolling basis. However, application deadline is 2025-12-11.
 



**To apply for the position:** 
 Please attach your CV and answer the questions in the following steps in the recruiting system.
 



**Work location:** 
 Bergshamra, Stockholm.
 



**Travelling:** 
 Some travelling is expected to other If offices in the Nordics and Baltics.
 



**Start:** 
 As soon as possible/By agreement.
 



  





 For more information, please contact Martin Wingert, Team Delivery Manager, martin.wingert@if.se.
 



  





 Final candidates will undergo a background check before employment.
 



  





**We look forward to your application!**

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Overview** 




  





 Paxport is a growing travel tech company transforming the digital travel experience. We provide innovative, API-first solutions for airlines and travel resellers.
 



  





 Being a small team working in an agile environment you will directly influence the evolution of our products. We’re heavily focused on aggregating APIs; both designing our own and integrating those offered by suppliers (airlines etc). We also love aggregating data; importing / exporting and all steps in between.
 



  





 Are you a seasoned Java Developer who thrives on complex challenges, including navigating and modernizing critical legacy systems? Do you possess the technical depth to build cutting-edge solutions while ensuring the stability of existing infrastructure? Join our dynamic team where you will be instrumental in evolving our core platform.
 



  





**About the Role** 




  





 We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Java Developer to join our engineering department. This role is unique and critical, requiring a strong background in modern Java development practices (Java 17+) coupled with a deep, practical understanding of older/legacy enterprise systems. You will be tasked with developing new features, optimizing performance, and strategically migrating components from our legacy codebase to a modern architecture.
 



  





 The ideal candidate will be a collaborative problem-solver, capable of designing large-scale system improvements and mentoring junior team members.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  





 Design, develop, test, and deploy highly performant and scalable applications using Java.
 



 Spearhead the analysis, refactoring, and strategic modernization of mission-critical legacy systems.
 



 Collaborate with product managers and other engineers to define feature specifications and deliver high-quality solutions.
 



 Ensure application stability and performance through rigorous testing and monitoring.
 



 Contribute to technical documentation and maintain clear code standards.
 



 Participate in code reviews and architectural discussions.
 



  





**Required Qualifications** 




  





**Experience:** 
 7+ years of professional software development experience, primarily with Java.
 



**Java Expertise:** 
 Mastery of modern Java (Java 17+) and the Spring framework (Spring Boot).
 



**Legacy Systems:** 
 Proven ability to understand, debug, and work effectively with older Java versions (e.g., Java 8, 7) and related enterprise technologies.
 



**Database Skills:** 
 Strong proficiency in SQL.
 



**Cloud/DevOps:** 
 Experience with GCP cloud platform and CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab CI).
 



**Testing:** 
 Expertise in unit, integration, and system testing.
 



**Microservices:** 
 Experience with microservices architecture and containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes).
 



**Scale:** 
 Working with large-scale, high-availability systems.
 



  





  





**Location and Work Model** 




  





**Location:** 
 Sweden / Hybrid / Stockholm Oﬀice

title: Materials Engineer
description:
What we do at Blykalla
   

  

*Blykalla is developing the next generation of nuclear technology with our Small Modular Reactor (SMR) based on innovative fuel, materials, and reactor designs. As Sweden’s only SMR developer, we are on a mission to decarbonize industries and enable safe, scalable, and sustainable energy solutions. Our technology uses uranium nitride fuel and lead coolant, creating novel challenges and opportunities for the fuel cycle and supporting systems.*
**What You’ll Get To Do**
 We are seeking a dynamic Materials Engineer to join our Materials team. This role is pivotal in advancing our materials knowhow, focusing on the development, qualification, and industrialization of new materials crucial for our SMR technology.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Materials Expertise and Advancement: Drive the transition of new materials from concept to industry, navigating challenges from lab to application. Harness deep knowledge in alloying concepts, steel production processes, material processes such as welding, to guide material qualification and industrialization.
* Strategic Qualification Planning and Execution: You will spearhead the strategic planning and meticulous execution of technical material qualifications in collaboration with our suppliers and partners. Your leadership in this area will ensure that our material development efforts are not only innovative but also compliant and tailored to meet the exacting demands of our projects.
* Regulatory Compliance: Apply an in-depth understanding of nuclear industry regulations to the material qualification process, ensuring compliance and translating regulatory requirements into actionable company-specific steps.
* Collaborative Cost Management: Work closely with the supply Chain team to maintain a Design-to-Cost approach throughout development and industrialization, balancing cost efficiency and quality assurance.
* Stakeholder Engagement: Provide regular updates to the Team Manager and other projects you are involved in, on progress, challenges, and any issues, ensuring transparent communication and stakeholder involvement.


 Who you are
   

  

 You will be part of a highly skilled team with a can-do attitude. We value personal chemistry and strive to create a workplace where you enjoy coming to. There are however a few things that we think will help in order for you to succeed in this role, these are:
   

  

* Functional Experience: Proven track record in technical project management, material engineering, or production quality, preferably within highly regulated industries such as nuclear, automotive, aviation, or space. Experience within the steel industry preferably in product development and industrialization.
* Qualifications: Engineering degree with specialization relevant to material science. Background in advanced steel alloys, corrosion, testing, welding and additive manufacturing. Experience in the steel industry working closely with suppliers on material development and a practical understanding of material qualification processes.


 Fluent in Swedish and English, spoken and written.
   

  

**Location**
 This position is for our office in Stockholm. We do not offer any relocation support for this role.
   

  

**So, what do you think?**
 Don't miss the chance to be at the forefront of revolutionizing nuclear power. Join our team and help shape the energy landscape of tomorrow. Apply today with your resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and achievements.
   

  

 We are proud to foster an inclusive workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to be a part of changing the way the world thinks about power supply!
   

  

**We do not accept applications via email.**
 We are not open to external help from recruitment agencies.
