*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* You have experience with Java or Kotlin and the Spring Boot ecosystem.
* You have a solid understanding of microservices, distributed systems, event-driven patterns, and API design.
* You have hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines, containerization (Docker), orchestration (Kubernetes), and security best practices.
* You are familiar with cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP) and infrastructure-as-code concepts.
* You have the ability to evaluate and implement logging, monitoring, and observability tooling.
* Experience working with or integrating low-code platforms is a plus.


**Application deadline:** 
 04-12-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Unreal Generalist Programmer
description:
We’re a small, independent mobile games studio building creative play experiences in Unreal Engine. Our first project is a 3D digital dollhouse focused on self-expression, storytelling, and playful tools.
 



  





 We’re audience first, collaborative, and driven by craft. We trust each other to do our best work, move fast when it matters, and learn from every risk we take.
 



  





**Who You Are** 




 You’re a team player who loves crafting creative experiences and connecting with players. You thrive in small teams where everyone pitches in, owns their part, and makes a visible impact.
 



 You’ll feel at home here if you:
 


* Live in Stockholm or close enough to join us in-office weekly
* Act with the team’s goals in mind and consider the ripple effects of your decisions.
* Communicate clearly, check in when unsure, and respect others’ areas of ownership.
* Support and mentor teammates when they need a hand.
* Spot what needs doing and take the initiative, even if it means stepping outside your comfort zone.
* Balance quality with pragmatism, moving fast while thinking ahead.
* Help keep momentum strong and meetings focused.
* Bring an upbeat, “we’ve got this” attitude and a creative, problem-solving mindset to challenges.
* Shift gear with purpose - we adapt when learning shows us a better way.
* Share your learnings and challenges openly so everyone can grow together.
* Above all, stay curious, collaborative, and committed to building something players will love.



 On our team, everyone contributes to how we create, plan, and grow together. No matter your role, we count on each other to:
 


* Take ownership of your learning and growth: stay curious, welcome feedback, and keep developing in your role.
* Actively review and give feedback on others’ work with openness and respect.
* Estimate and plan your work realistically and collaboratively.



  





**Your Role** 




 As our
 **Generalist Programmer** 
 , you’ll make sure that the team always keeps moving forward by being a jack of all trades that fills gaps and provides pragmatic solutions to a varied set of problems across multiple programming disciplines.
 



 You will:
 


* Implement player-facing gameplay features in Unreal Engine using C++
* Build and adapt UI flows and components using UMG
* Create and maintain small tools and Unreal editor extensions
* Tap into mobile platform specific features by integrating APIs for iOS and Android
* Help guide code quality and architectural consistency
* Write and maintain automated tests for gameplay systems and features
* Author relevant technical documentation



  





**What You’ll Bring** 



* 2+ years of professional experience programming games in Unreal Engine
* Shipped or live-supported at least one game title with external players
* Solid understanding of modern C++
* Proficiency with at least one of the following in Unreal Engine: Gameplay programming, UI programming or editor extension programming
* Proficiency with Git-based version control (or similar version control solution)



  





 Bonus points for:
 


* Formal degree in computer science or higher vocational education degree relevant to game programming
* Experience with developing games or apps for iOS and/or Android
* Experience with Unreal Engine build pipelines or general CI/CD experience
* Experience with automated testing



  





**What We Offer** 



* The trust, freedom, and camaraderie of a small, creative team chasing big ideas.
* A chance to join early and help shape the studio’s future.
* Flex time, a hybrid setup and genuine work–life balance.
* Friskvårdsbidrag and advanced vacation days to support your well-being.
* A chill, cozy environment just like our game.
* Space for creativity and exploration -
 *Play Days* 
 !



  





 If you feel that little spark of excitement, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Driven Applikationskonsult till Swedbyte
description:
Är du en strukturerad och lösningsorienterad person som brinner för att hjälpa kunder hantera sitt arbete, öka teamets produktivitet och koppla dagliga insatser till strategiska mål med hjälp av teknik? Har du en förmåga att se lösningar istället för problem och gillar att lära dig nya plattformar? Vill du arbeta med marknadsledande plattformar som gör det möjligt för team att arbeta tillsammans utan ansträngning, och ta en nyckelroll i ett växande tech-konsultbolag?
 





 Då kan du vara den vi söker till Swedbyte!
 




  




**Om Swedbyte** 


 Swedbyte är experter på att överbrygga klyftan mellan teknik och affärsbehov och har sedan 2011 levererat till kunder i över 40 länder. Vi är stolta partners till ledande SaaS-leverantörer som Google, Asana, Freshworks och Atera. Vi säljer inte bara licenser; vi levererar helhetslösningar som inkluderar strategisk rådgivning, implementation, integration och support, med särskilt fokus på kundservice, samarbete, arbetsledning och ITSM/ESM.
   





**Om Rollen** 


 Vi söker dig som vill bli en central applikationskonsult med fokus på plattformar för samarbete och arbetsledning, där Asana är ett av våra nyckelområden. Hos oss får du en nyckelroll i ett litet, sammansvetsat team där du har stor frihet under ansvar och ditt driv gör direkt skillnad.
 





 Du kommer att agera som länken mellan kundens verksamhetsbehov och teknikens möjligheter. Du kommer att arbeta med moderna plattformar som ligger i framkant när det gäller att använda AI för att öka kundernas produktivitet.
   





**Vad du kommer att göra:** 
* **Bli expert:** 

 Lägga mycket tid på att certifiera dig och lära dig plattformarna (särskilt Asana). Hålla dig ständigt uppdaterad om ny funktionalitet och ta nya certifieringar.
* **Leverera värde:** 

 Hjälpa nya och befintliga kunder att sätta upp och konfigurera plattformarna på bästa sätt utifrån deras specifika verksamhetsbehov.
* **Demonstrera och utbilda:** 

 Demonstrera hur plattformarna fungerar och hur de bäst kan användas i kundens verksamhet, både för enskilda kunder och på events.
* **Driva projekt:** 

 Delta i olika projekt där du leder dialogen med kunden och tar hjälp av våra interna utvecklare vid mer tekniska uppdrag som t.ex. Integrationer.
* **Delta i säljprocessen:** 

 I säljprocessen bidrar du med din djupa kunskap inom plattformen för att hitta rätt lösning åt kunden.
* **Lösa problem:** 

 Använda din nyfikenhet och pedagogiska förmåga för att hjälpa kunderna bli mer framgångsrika i sina verksamheter.



  




**Vem är du?** 


 Vi lägger mycket stor vikt vid dina
 
**personliga egenskaper** 

 . Vi söker dig som är:
 



* **Utåtriktad & Pedagogisk:** 

 Du är positiv, nyfiken och har lätt för att bygga förtroende och förklara komplexa lösningar på ett enkelt sätt.
* **Lösningsorienterad:** 

 Du har ett genuint intresse för kunders verksamhet och teknikens möjligheter, och du gillar att lösa problem och tänka utanför boxen.
* **Lärande & Självgående:** 

 Du har lätt för att lära dig och ta till dig ny information, och du tar egna initiativ för att driva ditt arbete framåt.
* **Bakgrund:** 

 Du har några års arbetslivserfarenhet och en bakgrund inom antingen IT, försäljning eller kundvårdande relationer. Kanske har du jobbat på kundtjänst eller i ett SaaS-bolag.
* **Flytande i svenska och engelska** 

 i tal och skrift.



  





**Krav:** 



* Tidigare certifiering eller kunskap om Asana eller någon konkurrerande produkt (
 
 t.ex
 
 .
 
 monday.com
 
 , Clickup, Jira, Trello, Wrike, MS Project, etc)



  





**Meriterande egenskaper:** 



* Tidigare erfarenhet av att jobba med liknande system (t.ex. som användare eller administratör).
* Ytterligare språk eller relevant högskoleutbildning.



  




**Vad vi erbjuder:** 
* En central roll i ett framgångsrikt och växande företag med internationell räckvidd.
* Möjligheten att arbeta med marknadsledande SaaS-plattformar och AI-drivna lösningar.
* En dynamisk arbetsmiljö i nya lokaler nära Odenplan, Stockholm (Surbrunnsgatan 42).
* Konkurrenskraftiga villkor inklusive pension (ITP), semester och friskvårdsbidrag.
* Möjlighet till visst distansarbete efter en introduktionsperiod, men initialt behöver du vara mycket på kontoret och hos våra kunder.



  






 Är du redo att bli en nyckelspelare i Swedbytes konsultteam och hjälpa våra kunder lyckas med Asana? Skicka in din ansökan idag!

title: Media Strategist
description:
**About WPP Media**
 WPP is the creative transformation company. We use the power of creativity to build better futures for our people, planet, clients and communities. For more information, visit wpp.com.
   

  

 WPP Media is WPP’s global media collective. In a world where media is everywhere and in everything, we bring the best platform, people, and partners together to create limitless opportunities for growth. For more information, visit wppmedia.com
   

  

**Role**
 At WPP Media, we believe in the power of our culture and our people. It’s what elevates us to deliver exceptional experiences for both our clients and each other. In this role it will be critical to embrace WPP & WPP Media’s shared core values:
   

  

* Be Extraordinary by Leading Collectively to Inspire transformational Creativity.
* Create an Open environment by Balancing People and Client Experiences by Cultivating Trust.
* Lead Optimistically by Championing Growth and Development to Mobilize the Enterprise.


**Role Summary And Impact**
 As a Media Strategist at WPP Media, you’ll help shape media campaigns based on audience insights, channel knowledge, data, set KPIs, previous learnings, and strategic goals. You work closely with clients, Client Leads, and our in-house specialists to ensure our campaigns are continuously optimized and deliver real business value.
   

  

 We believe a great Media Strategist is naturally curious and stays up to date with the latest trends, formats, and platforms. You're excited about the opportunity to guide others, supporting the growth of junior team members and helping clients understand the evolving role of media.
   

  

 You bring a holistic view of media planning and understand how different channels work together to meet client objectives. In your role, you’ll collaborate with Media Managers, Media Executives, and specialists across disciplines. You’ll also be responsible for crafting briefs to ensure we get the best possible output from our specialist teams.
   

  

**Skills And Experience**
 We’re looking for someone who’s passionate about media, strategy, and creating impact. You don’t have to tick every single box, but here are some things that might describe you:
   

  

* You follow trends in marketing, media, data, and technology — and you’re curious to keep learning.
* You enjoy working collaboratively and believe the best ideas come from diverse teams.
* You take a creative and strategic approach to problem-solving, always with the client’s goals in mind.
* You understand how different media channels work together to create results, and you’re comfortable connecting media strategy to KPIs and business outcomes.
* You’re hands-on when needed and have an eye for both detail and the bigger picture.
* You’re comfortable in a dynamic, fast-moving environment and like to take initiative.
* You value an international work culture and are fluent in Swedish and English, both written and spoken.


**Your Background Might Include**
* Around 5 years of experience working with digital media strategy from agency side.
* A solid understanding of the digital media landscape, and ideally, experience across other media types too.
* Experience presenting ideas and recommendations to different stakeholders.
* A degree in marketing, economics, communications, or similar — or equivalent experience.


**Life At WPP Media & Benefits**
 Our passion for shaping the next era of media includes investing in our employees to help them do their best work, and we’re just as committed to employee growth as we are to responsible media investment. WPP Media employees can tap into the global WPP Media & WPP networks to pursue their passions, grow their networks, and learn at the cutting edge of marketing and advertising.
   

  

 In Sweden, our benefits include a SEK 3,000 wellness allowance, a 37,5-hour workweek, half-days and “klämdagar" off, 30 days of vacation, and two paid volunteer days per year. WPP Media Sweden is a member of Almega, and all employees are covered by a collective bargaining agreement (kollektivavtal), which ensures occupational pension, insurance, and other negotiated terms. We host regular team activities, knowledge-sharing sessions, and wellness initiatives throughout the year.
   

  

 WPP Media is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to particular characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.
   

  

  

  

 We believe the best work happens when we're together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection. That's why we’ve adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office around four days a week. If you require accommodations or flexibility, please discuss this with the hiring team during the interview process.
   

  

**Application**
 This is a full-time permanent position with a start date as soon as possible. We apply a six-month probationary period. In addition to reviewing your CV and conducting interviews, our recruitment process includes a testing phase. Selection and interviews are ongoing, so please submit your application with your CV and cover letter as soon as possible.
   

  

 We believe that diverse perspectives make us stronger and encourage applications from people of all genders, backgrounds, and experiences.
   

  

**Contact**
 If you have questions about the position, feel free to contact Nils Wimby, nils.wimby@wppmedia.com. Due to GDPR, we do not accept applications via email.
   

  

 Please read our Privacy Notice for more information on how we process the information you provide.

title: Senior Compliance Officer
description:
Dedicated to powering entrepreneurs, Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech bank. In just 10 years, we’ve gone from startup to hitting 1 billion SEK in annual revenue, supporting over 50,000 businesses and helping create 10,000+ jobs every year. As we continue to expand across Europe, we’re looking for a Senior Compliance Officer who thrives on clarity, ownership, and responsibility. Someone who knows how to turn regulatory language into something people understand and can act on.
   

  

 This is the perfect role for a person who enjoys taking ownership and wants to make sure everything works when things move fast. It's about creating structure and driving results in a dynamic, evolving environment.
   

  

 If this sounds like your kind of challenge - keep on reading!
   

  

 What your days might look like
   

  

 This is not a role where you will sit on the sidelines and review policies from afar. It is hands-on, in the middle of a fast-moving fintech bank, where compliance is about transforming regulations into scalable structures that empower the business.
   

  

 You will lead regulatory processes and implementation projects, coordinate audits, and review policies. You will turn regulations into clear, practical guidance while ensuring processes remain efficient and that your colleagues are informed. And when the regulatory landscape shifts, you will already be ahead of it.
   

  

 In this role you will be part of the Legal & Compliance Team, reporting to the Chief Legal Officer, and work closely with the Senior Management and teams across the company to keep our foundation solid as we scale.
   

  

 Who we think you are
   

  

 You likely have five or more years of experience in compliance, either from a financial institution, fintech company, or a consultancy firm. You’re experienced in handling SFSA engagements and well-versed in GDPR and privacy matters. You’re structured, calm under pressure, and known for your ability to run complex projects with precision and follow-through. You care about doing things right, but also about making things work. You are fluent in Swedish and English.
   

  

 Why Qred?
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to join a growing fintech bank that is redefining financial services for small businesses in Northern Europe. You will work with a passionate and innovative team, participating in creating an environment where employees thrive and contribute to a shared vision of success.
   

  

 Here, legal and compliance are part of the conversation, not an afterthought. You will have direct access to decision-makers, real influence, and the freedom to improve things rather than just maintain them.
   

  

**One last thing**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.
   

  

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*
 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: Avdelningsadministratör
description:
Vi söker en Avdelningsadministratör till en myndighet in elkraft.
   

  

 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag. Stationeringsort är Stockholm.
   

  

 Tjänsten är på heltid.
   

  

 Uppdraget innebär ett nära samarbete med kunden vilket ställer stora krav på flexibilitet och samarbetsförmåga.
   

  

**Uppdraget**
 Rollen som avdelningsadministratör innebär att ge administrativt stöd till avdelningschef samt flera sektions- och enhetschefer. Syftet är att säkerställa ett effektivt och välstrukturerat verksamhetsflöde genom att avlasta cheferna i deras dagliga arbete. Rollen är delad mellan flera enheter och kräver självständighet, god prioriteringsförmåga och ansvarstagande i hantering av administrativa processer, dokumentation, personalstöd, inköp, ekonomi och kommunikation.
   

  

 Arbetet omfattar planering, genomförande och uppföljning av administrativa uppgifter, koordinering av möten och interna aktiviteter, hantering av system och rutiner samt stöd till avdelningens ledningsgrupp. Administratören förväntas lyfta behov av omprioritering vid belastningstoppar och själv boka in nödvändiga avstämningar.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
**Administrativt stöd till chefer**
 Hantera kalendrar, boka möten och förbereda material och presentationer.
   

  

 Administrera och samordna underlag och beslut kopplade till konsulter och medarbetare (t.ex. delegeringar, jävsdeklarationer).
   

  

 Uppdatera information och sidor på intranätet.
   

  

**Personaladministration**
 Stöd vid onboarding och offboarding, inklusive beställning av utrustning, behörigheter och accesser.
   

  

 Hantera semesterlistor samt stötta vid introduktionsprogram och interna aktiviteter.
   

  

**Ekonomi och inköp**
 Genomföra inköp av material, utrustning och tjänster.
   

  

 Ta fram enklare rapporter i UBW samt hantera fakturor och kontering vid behov.
   

  

**Mötes- och eventkoordinering**
 Planera och koordinera interna möten, workshops och konferenser, inklusive lokal-, teknik- och cateringbokning.
   

  

 Skapa agendor, föra protokoll och ge löpande stöd till ledningsgruppen, såsom planering av årshjul, agendor, dokumentation av beslut och uppföljning av actions.
   

  

**Kommunikation och dokumentation**
 Uppdatera intranät och presentationsmaterial, skriva enklare beslutsunderlag och sköta dokumenthantering på filserver och SharePoint samt diarieföring.
   

  

 Skapa och uppdatera rutiner inom eget ansvarsområde samt samverka med administratörsnätverket.
   

  

**Arbetsledning och avstämningar**
 Månatliga avstämningar med enhets-/sektionschefer och två per månad med avdelningschef inför ledningsgruppsmöten.
   

  

 Ansvar för att lyfta behov av prioritering och boka in avstämningsmöten.
   

  

**Krav (OBS, obligatoriska)**
 Flytande svenska i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Minst ett års eftergymnasial utbildning inom till exempel ekonomi, HR eller administration.
   

  

 Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet i rollen som administratör med arbetsuppgifter såsom:
   

  

* Dokumentation, uppföljning och rapportering av enheternas verksamhet
* Mötes- och konferensbokningar samt resebokningar
* Protokollskrivning
* Planering av möten och workshops
* On-/offboarding av medarbetare och konsulter
* Beställningar av olika slag (exempelvis: catering, kontorsmaterial, IT, etc.)


 Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att arbeta med MS Office program som Excel, Word, Powerpoint och Outlook.
   

  

 Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att dokumentera ledningsgrupps-/styrgruppsmöten eller liknande beslutande verksamhet.
   

  

**Meriterande**
 Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av administration i offentlig verksamhet, t.ex. statlig eller kommunal.
   

  

 Minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet av ekonomisystemet UBW/Agresso eller motsvarande.
   

  

**Övriga krav**
**Säkerhetsprövning:** 
 Säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll krävs.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Centios övergripande mål är att vara ett konsultbolag som erbjuder smarta och hållbara lösningar som utvecklar samhället på ett positivt sätt.
   

  

 Våra medarbetare erbjuds villkor som är anpassade för individen. Det innebär att arbetstider, arbetsomfattning, arbetsplats och kompetensutveckling så långt som möjligt anpassas utifrån medarbetarens behov.
   

  

 Bland våra medarbetare hittar du engagerad personer som brinner för samhällsutveckling. Vi jobbar i små grupper där du kan bidra med dina erfarenheter samtidigt som du får ta del av andras kunskap och erfarenhet.
   

  

 För oss är det viktigt med välmående och att hitta en sund balans mellan arbete och fritid. Därför har vi en nollvision mot stress och sätter trivsel och hälsa främst.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om oss på centio.se.
   

  

**Vänligen skicka ditt CV på svenska.**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**Be visionary**
 Teledyne Technologies Incorporated provides enabling technologies for industrial growth markets that require advanced technology and high reliability. These markets include aerospace and defense, factory automation, air and water quality environmental monitoring, electronics design and development, oceanographic research, deepwater oil and gas exploration and production, medical imaging and pharmaceutical research.
   

  

 We are looking for individuals who thrive on making an impact and want the excitement of being on a team that wins.
   

  

**Job Description**
**Financial Analyst – Täby, Sweden**
**Your contribution**
 We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Financial Analyst to join our Sweden Surveillance finance team. The role reports to the Controller of our Sweden Surveillance business, within the Teledyne FLIR Defense business unit. The successful candidate will play a key role in interpreting financial data, forecasting trends, and supporting strategic decision-making across our operations in Sweden and its markets.
   

  

**Your job in plain text**
* Analyze financial data and market trends.
* Prepare financial reports, forecasts and models to support decision making
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align financial strategies with business goals.
* Conduct variance analysis, provide actionable insights to improve financial performance.
* Perform period, quarter and year end close activities
* Support quarterly and annual financial planning processes.
* Monthly Backlog Reporting
* Extended warranty tracking and release
* CER processes and submittals, including demo and assets under construction
* Time Reporting administration for Surveillance Sweden
* Analysis and reporting of monthly financial/operational metrics (KPIs)
* ASC606 checklist preparation and reporting
* Service WIP analysis and adjusting
* Ensure compliance with Swedish financial regulations and US reporting standards.
* Operating Expense analysis and other analytical data
* Support audit processes (Internal, SOX, External etc)
* Assistance with Budget preparation for entire financial package for the sites; revenue, margin, cost centers
* Assign g/l coding and approve purchase orders
* Other duties as required


**We would love if you have**
* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting or a related field
* 3+ years of experience in financial analysis, preferably within the Nordic region.
* Strong understanding of Swedish financial regulations and business practices.
* Prior experience of SAP desirable
* Proficiency in financial modeling and analysis tools (e.g., Excel, Power BI).
* Excellent communication skills in English and Swedish language
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.


**Interested?**
 If you liked what you just read, and believe you are the person that will make us better, do not hesitate to apply.
   

  

 The selection process is ongoing, so don't wait
   

  

 When applying, make it easy for yourself. Add a resume and fill out the required fields, no need to add anything else at this point.
   

  

 We accept applications in English and Swedish.
   

  

*This position requires access to export-controlled information or items (i.e. regulated technology or technical data per ITAR/EAR US regulations). Applicants must be eligible to apply for and obtain the appropriate export control license from the U.S. Departments of State or Commerce.*
 Teledyne and all of our employees are committed to conducting business with the highest ethical standards. We require all employees to comply with all applicable laws, regulations, rules and regulatory orders. Our reputation for honesty, integrity and high ethics is as important to us as our reputation for making innovative sensing solutions.

title: Product Owner Members - OKQ8 Tech
description:
*Hela samhället ställer om mot en fossilfri framtid. Vi vill visa vägen i utvecklingen av vår bransch, så att fler kan ta sig fram, ta hand om sitt fordon och driva verksamheter med ett så lågt klimatavtryck som möjligt. Vill du vara med och bidra till hållbar utveckling, på riktigt? Välkommen att följa med på vår resa!*
 Vill du driva digital innovation och leda utvecklingen av en av Sveriges största lojalitetsplattformar? Hos oss på OKQ8 Tech blir du en nyckelperson i vår digitala transformation och får kombinera affärsutveckling med teknisk innovation.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Digital Product Owner för vårt medlemsprogram ansvarar du för att realisera affärens behov i teknik och skapa förutsättningar för smarta lösningar som driver kundengagemang och lojalitet. Du har helhetsansvar för vår medlemsplattform – från förvaltning av befintligt system till migrering till en modern datamiljö.
   

  

 Du blir en central aktör i vårt arbete med att stärka kundrelationer och skapa datadrivna erbjudanden. Rollen innebär nära samarbete med affären, IT, leverantörer och ett offshore-utvecklingsteam.
   

  

**Dina huvudansvar**
* Äga roadmap, backlog och prioritering för medlemsplattformen.
* Säkerställa att tekniska lösningar möter affärsbehov och följer vår arkitektur och standarder.
* Ansvara för nuvarande medlemsapplikation, inklusive förvaltning, samt leda migreringen till ny datamiljö.
* Driva modernisering av medlemskapet med fokus på personifiering och datadriven kommunikation via marketing automation.
* Utvärdera och hantera externa tekniska leverantörer och partners.
* Definiera och följa upp KPI:er för plattformen och rapportera värde till stakeholders.


 Vi tror att du är en erfaren produktägare eller projektledare med stark teknisk förståelse och affärssinne. Du trivs med att arbeta i gränslandet mellan affär och teknik och har förmåga att omsätta kommersiella koncept till tekniska lösningar.
   

  

**Du har:**
* Erfarenhet av produktägarroll eller liknande, gärna inom lojalitet, CRM eller kunddata.
* God förståelse för systemintegrationer, API-tjänster och databashantering.
* Erfarenhet av Azure DevOps eller liknande verktyg.
* Kompetens i SQL.
* Vana att arbeta med budget och ekonomisk uppföljning.
* Erfarenhet av agila metoder och processer.


**Meriterande:**
* Erfarenhet av MarTech, CRM och Marketing Automation.
* Ledning av offshore-utvecklingsteam.
* Kunskap i BI-verktyg som Power BI.
* Erfarenhet från bank/finans eller betallösningar.


 Som person har du troligtvis ett holistiskt perspektiv där du ser både affären och tekniken samt är kommunikativ och pedagogisk i ditt sätt att samarbeta. Du drivs av att tänka nytt och nå resultat, samtidigt som din nyfikenhet och strukturerade arbetsstil hjälper dig att skapa tydlighet och ta dig an utmaningar på ett tryggt sätt.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Hos oss på OKQ8 får du arbeta i en flexibel miljö med viktiga och varierande arbetsuppgifter. Vi uppmuntrar samarbete, innovation och utveckling – och vi tror på att vi tillsammans gör varandra bättre. Här blir du en del av en familjär kultur där vi stöttar varandra, har roligt tillsammans och där du ges möjlighet att växa och göra skillnad. Vi vill vara ett företag som speglar samhället, med en inkluderande kultur som minskar utanförskap och främjar mångfald.
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Thomas Klausbo
   

  

* Har du frågor om rekryteringsprocessen vänligen kontakta Talent Partner Sophie Welin


**Placeringsort:**
 Stockholm, Sveavägen.
   

  

**Tillträde:**
 Enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

**Anställningsform:**
 Tillsvidareanställning med sex månaders provanställning
   

  

 För den här tjänsten behöver du vara medborgare i Sverige, ett annat nordiskt land eller ett EU/EES-land, ha permanent uppehållstillstånd i Sverige eller vara asylsökande med rätt att arbeta. Du ska kunna styrka ditt medborgarskap eller din rätt att arbeta i Sverige under rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

*I rekryteringsprocessen ingår både psykometriska tester och kompetensbaserade intervjuer, med syfte att främja en rättvis utvärdering för alla kandidater.* 
**Välkommen med din ansökan!** 
 Om företaget
 **Ditt livs kanske viktigaste jobb. På riktigt.**
 Vi vet att det är en vågad sak att säga, men vi menar verkligen varje ord. Oavsett om det handlar om ditt första jobb, ditt sista jobb, eller om du har modet att anta en ny utmaning, tror vi att du kan få ditt livs kanske viktigaste jobb här hos oss. På riktigt.

title: Implemas Traineeprogram 2026
description:
**Implemas Traineeprogram 2026** 

*Redo att ta första klivet in i arbetslivet? Är du intresserad av att jobba som konsult, samarbeta tätt i team och stötta kunder på deras digitaliseringsresa? Då kan Implemas Traineeprogram vara ditt nästa steg!* 




*Sedan 2004 har vi utbildat talanger till självgående och lösningsorienterade expertkonsulter inom affärssystem. Vårt traineeprogram ligger oss varmt om hjärtat, och ungefär en tredjedel av nuvarande anställda har startat sin karriär genom det, vilket vi är mycket stolta över!* 
  




**Ditt första kliv in i arbetslivet** 

 Som trainee på Implema utbildas du till konsult inom affärssystem. Med hjälp av de marknadsledande affärssystemen, SAP och Microsoft Dynamics 365, kommer du jobba med att utveckla våra kunders affärsprocesser.
 



 Oavsett inriktning är du med och bidrar till att kunderna kan maximera nyttan av sina affärssystem, som i sin tur stärker deras konkurrenskraft. Vi trivs bäst med att jobba tillsammans; såväl med juniora och seniora kollegor som med våra kunder.
 



 Implemas traineeprogram startar i juni 2026. Vi varvar teori med praktik i syfte att ge dig som trainee de bästa förutsättningarna för att snabbt utvecklas till självgående konsult. Du blir även tilldelad en mentor som finns som extra stöttning under såväl traineeprogrammet som tiden efter.
 



 Under 2026 års traineeprogram har vi möjlighet att erbjuda platser i Stockholm, Linköping, Umeå, Malmö, Västerås och Göteborg.
 


**Vi söker dig som** 
* Är/blir nyutexaminerad civilingenjör, civilekonom/ekonom, systemvetare, datavetare, kognitionsvetare eller likvärdig utbildning.
* Har ett tydligt intresse för IT och digitalisering.
* Behärskar svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.



 Det är ett stort plus om du har praktiskt erfarenhet av affärssystem men det är inget krav för att söka, vår utbildning ger dig den kunskaper du behöver. I rekryteringsprocessen lägger vi stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och drivkrafter.
 



 För att trivas i rollen som affärssystemkonsult på Implema tror vi att du:
 


* Intresseras av att jobba i en kundnära roll
* Trivs och motiveras av att jobba i team
* Tycker om att utmana dig själv och andra
* Är nyfiken samt ivrig att lära och utvecklas


**Applikationskonsult, transformationskonsult eller integrationskonsult?** 

 Vi har möjligheten att utbilda våra traineer inom
 **tre olika typer av konsultroller** 
 , där vi matchar roll med din utbildningsbakgrund, erfarenhet och intresse.
 *Svårt att avgöra vilket område och inriktning som passar dig?* 
 Oroa dig inte, under rekryteringsprocessen pratar vi mer om detta och bestämmer därefter, tillsammans med dig, var du ser dig själv börja din karriär på Implema.
 


**Som applikationskonsult får du:** 
* Utbilda dig i antingen SAP eller Dynamics och fördjupa dig inom
 **ekonomi/finans** 
 eller
 **logistik/produktion**
* Vara bryggan mellan IT och verksamhet och hjälpa kunder att förbättra deras arbetssätt och affärsprocesser genom att implementera rätt systemstöd.
* Tillsammans med ditt projektteam vara med i hela processen: förstå behov, konfigurera lösningen och hålla utbildningar som hjälper kunden att lyckas i sin övergång till helt nya eller förbättrade lösningar.


**Som transformationskonsult får du:** 
* Leda och stötta kunder genom deras transformationsresor. Genom analys, strategi, rådgivning, förändringsledning och projektledning hjälper du organisationer att lyckas i en allt mer digital och dynamisk värld
* Utvecklas inom områden som strategi och affärsutveckling, process- och verksamhetsdesign. Du utbildas inom SAP som affärssystem.
* Jobba tillsammans med erfarna kollegor och samarbeta tvärfunktionellt över våra affärsområden.


**Som integrationskonsult får du:** 
* Skapa smarta flöden mellan våra kunders affärssystem. Ofta förstärkta med AI via språkmodeller och agenter.
* Utvecklas inom affär, design, utveckling, kartläggning och projektledning då du levererar integrationstjänster som gör skillnad över tid.
* Vara en del av ett team som levererar tillsammans med hög kvalitet och engagemang.


**Implema -
 *tillsammans, förtroende, mod, glädje***

 Vi erbjuder dig en utmanande och varierande roll där du får möjlighet att växa och påverka under hela din resa, från trainee till utbildad juniorkonsult hos oss. På Implema präglas vår kultur av
 **tillsammans** 
 – vi tror på laget före jaget – och vi värdesätter
 **förtroende** 
 och öppenhet, så att du tryggt kan pröva din egen kreativitet och lösningsförmåga.
 



 Vi uppmuntrar dig att visa
 **mod** 
 i ditt arbete, testa nya idéer och utvecklas i en miljö med högt i tak. Och vi glömmer inte bort
 **glädjen** 
 längs vägen – både på jobbet och i våra aktiviteter som kundevents, nätverksträffar, AW:s, resor och kick-offer.

title: Android Engineer - User Platform
description:
We are looking for an experienced engineer to help us build the key device analysis capabilities across the Android ecosystem. This role focuses on deep, systems-level engineering to design and implement a cutting-edge security solution. Your primary responsibility will be to maximize the collection of high-entropy device signals while implementing a multi-layered defense against OS-level compromise, all within the bounds of Google's policies.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Take full ownership of implementing our device identification solution on the Android platform, including phones, tablets, Android TV, and Wear OS.
* Implement robust, multi-layered root detection techniques to identify and defend against OS-level compromise.
* Integrate with Google Play Services, particularly the Play Integrity API, to assess device and application integrity verdicts.
* Be a part of a cross functional team - collaborating closely to ensure the Android implementation is secure, performant, and aligned with the team's overall strategy.
* Analyse the available data using tools like BigQuery to find patterns, analyse impact and improve our offering.
* Work across the stack using diverse technologies like C++, Kotlin, Java and Scala.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have a deep command of Android's internal architecture, including the SDK, PackageManager, and system properties, going far beyond standard app development.
* You have working experience with C++ and Kotlin.
* You are an inclusive colleague who thrives in a collaborative environment.
* You can pick up new skills to unblock yourself and improve the impact you deliver.
* You have a desire to drive business impact
* You proactively keep up with current best practices in your areas of expertise


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London or Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in-person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Talent Acquisition Partner 1 year Fixed term
description:
**With a passion for life**
 Join our diverse teams of passionate people and a career that allows you to develop both personally and professionally. At Getinge we exist to make life-saving technology accessible for more people. To make a true difference for our customers – and to save more lives, we need team players, forward thinkers, and game changers.
   

  

 Are you looking for an inspiring career? You just found it.
   

  

 Are you passionate about attracting top talent and shaping the future of healthcare? Join Getinge as a Talent Acquisition Partnerand play a key role in building high-performing teams that make a real difference in people’s lives. This is a maternaty cover, one year fixed term contract. Welcome to our team of ambitious and strategic Talent Aqcuisition partners where where sharing best practice and passion for people is essential.
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 In this role, your primary responsibility will be to manage full-cycle recruitment and providing strategic talent acquisition support across the business to attract and select high-quality candidates. Additionally, the Talent Acquisition Partner is accountable for improving local recruitment processes, creating talent pools, and leveraging systems data and market trends to influence recruitment outcomes. You will belong to a Talent Acquisition team mainly located in Nordics/CEE, and your main responsibility will be to support our Sales and Service units across Northern and Southern Europe.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Manage the end-to-end recruitment process, including talent sourcing, pipelining, screening, conducting interviews, assessments, and providing continuous guidance to Hiring Managers throughout the process.
* Act as the process owner and Subject Matter Expert (SME) in talent acquisition, driving best practices across the recruitment function.
* Collaborate with HR and Hiring Managers to design and execute targeted recruitment campaigns, strategically addressing talent gaps and aligning with organizational needs to attract the right candidates.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with business leaders, HR Business Partners, current employees, and candidates, fostering a positive recruitment experience.
* Continuously develop an understanding of market dynamics to inform talent acquisition strategies.
* Advise, train, and support business leaders and HR Business Partners on talent acquisition strategies, recruitment processes, and best practices.
* Partner with Local HR and business teams to drive employer branding and university relations activities, including social media branding, recruitment campaigns, and participation in local career fairs.


 This position is based remotely but preferably in Stockholm region. Travel will be limited but may occur.
   

  

**You will bring**
 To be successful in this position, we believe that you have the following qualifications.
   

  

* Academic degree in Human resources, business economics or similar
* Some years of in-house and/or agency recruitment experience, preferably in regulated industries such as medical device, healthcare or manufacturing.
* Strong track record in supporting hiring needs across all levels, including remote teams.
* Skilled in utilizing tools such as ATS, LinkedIn Recruiter, Talent Insights, job boards, and social media platforms to identify and attract high-quality talent, while continuously building and managing candidate pipelines.
* Experience within cross national recruitments
* Fluency in English, orally and written, swedish is an advantage


 In addition to your technical skills, we highly value your personality. We think you have excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to coach, negotiate, and influence across various levels of the organization. You are skilled in maintaining clear, transparent, and engaging communication with candidates throughout the hiring process, ensuring a positive candidate experience while guiding them towards successful outcomes
   

  

 We think you have an ambition for growth and improvement and an eagerness for keeping up to date with the latest within Talent Acquisition trends.
   

  

**Why join Getinge**
 Getinge offers a job in a safe and informal work environment, where we appreciate close team collaboration. We keep an open dialogue between leaders and employees, as well as between teams. We are focused on developing people, and together we will create a plan for learning and competence development when you start your career with us.
   

  

 We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, including wellness allowances, generous family benefits and joint company activities. Everything to ensure we support your well-being and goals.
   

  

**Application**
 Applications will be reviewed continually, and we therefore recommend sending us your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 We kindly ask you to submit your application in our recruitment system by clicking the “apply now” button. Due to GDPR regulations we do not accept applications via e-mail.
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact Hiring Manager Emma Paulsson at emma.paulsson@getinge.com.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application. We hope you will join us on our journey to make life-saving equipment accessible for more people.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application. We hope you will join us on our journey to make life-saving equipment accessible for more people.

title: Procurement Manager
description:
We’re looking for a Procurement Manager to join Mathem temporarily!
   

  

 As Procurement Manager, you will enhance customer and employee experiences by leading the purchasing team responsible for inbound logistics. The responsibilities include developing logistical solutions for Mathem, including supplier development and improving the replenishment system, RELEX. Additionally, the role involves ensuring compliance, availability, and waste reduction, supporting the COO in achieving growth goals, and collaborating cross-functionally with teams like Commercial, Growth, Product & Tech.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing As a Procurement Manager**
* Drive continuous improvement in replenishment practices, aiming for world-class availability and spoilage with low inventory levels.
* Work close with fulfillment and commercial to continuously improve customer satisfaction and cost.
* Develop and nurture relationships with suppliers to enhance inbound logistics and mutual growth.
* Promote an inclusive environment where all team members thrive, supporting their development, empowering them with autonomy, and purpose, and fostering a culture of continuous learning and knowledge sharing internally and externally.


**What You’ll Need To Succeed 🌟**
* Achievement of continuous improvement goals in Replenishment practices, evidenced by enhanced quality, delivery precision, and customer satisfaction metrics.
* Contribution to the development and implementation of effective departmental routines and standards, resulting in improved KPIs, OKRs, and compliance measures.
* Optimization of product availability and fulfillment costs, demonstrated by reduced waste and enhanced cost-efficiency metrics.
* Establishment and maintenance of strong relationships with suppliers, leading to improved inbound logistics and mutual growth opportunities.
* Creation of an inclusive environment fostering team development, autonomy, and knowledge sharing, reflected in improved team performance, employee satisfaction, and internal/external collaboration metrics.
* Independent work within the defined scope, requiring minimal support from extended management, peer countries, or the central organization.


**What Would Be Nice To Have 💡**
* Extensive background in replenishment operations, with a proven track record of driving continuous improvement initiatives to achieve world-class quality and delivery precision.
* Solid understanding of logistics and operational value chains
* Proficiency in understanding cost drivers and dynamics to ensure product availability, minimize waste, and optimize fulfillment costs.
* Experience in developing and nurturing relationships with suppliers
* Strong leadership skills to promote an inclusive and high-performance environment where all team members thrive.
* Ability to support team members’ development, empower them with autonomy and purpose, and cultivate a culture of continuous learning and knowledge sharing internally and externally.
* Fluent proficiency in both spoken and written English and Swedish is required.


**Practical Information**
* Percentage: 100% FTE
* Position type: Fixed-term, from February 2026 to April 2027
* Location: Fryksdalsbacken 9, 123 43 Farsta


**A few final words**
 At Mathem, you’ll join a passionate, ambitious team working to change the future of grocery shopping. We’re all different-just like you-and we wouldn’t have it any other way. If you need any adjustments or support during the application process, just let us know, and we’ll do our best to help. We believe in the strength of a diverse workforce and want everyone to have an equal shot at landing the job. 🧡
   

  

 We can’t wait to hear from you! 🧡

title: Growth Minds - Community and Communications Director
description:
**About Growth minds** 





 Growth minds is a fellowship of startup and scale-up founders and executives in Stockholm. Members pay an annual contribution to participate in a curated community of leaders who meet consistently to sharpen their thinking, grow their companies, and support one another while building a better Europe.
 




  





**We bring members together through:** 




**• Tables** 

 — groups of ~10 leaders who meet monthly for structured, confidential discussions centered on business, family, and self.
 





 •
 
**Afterworks** 

 — monthly social gatherings for the full community.
 





 •
 
**Education sessions** 

 — private sessions where founders share practical, experience-based insights.
 





 •
 
**International trips** 

 — e.g. Silicon Valley, Marbella, Berlin.
 




  






 We are expanding quickly, including new branches in Copenhagen and additional countries coming next year. As the network grows past 100 members, we are strengthening the team to continue delivering an exceptional member experience.
 




  






 Members of Growth minds lead some of the fastest-growing companies in the region. Recent collaborators come from Lovable, Tandem Health, Revolut, Spotify, and many others. This role places you in a position to support and accelerate the impact of people in this high-performing community.
 




  





**Role overview** 





 You ensure that every member has an excellent experience throughout their year in Growth minds. The role combines community operations, member care, communication, and event planning. You run all afterworks, education sessions, and international trips. You build ongoing relationships with members, gather feedback, act on it, and improve the experience so they feel excited to continue their membership each year.
 




  






 You work closely with an event-operations staff member who supports logistics and on-site execution, while you remain responsible for planning, quality, and consistency across all touchpoints.
 




  





**Community responsibilities** 





 • Lead operational delivery of the Growth minds experience across afterworks, education sessions, and international trips.
 





 • Plan, organize, and manage events from concept to execution.
 





 • Run structured member-satisfaction workflows including onboarding, quarterly check-ins, and ongoing support.
 





 • Build feedback loops and turn insights into improvements across programming, communication, and event quality.
 





 • Ensure members feel supported and have their achievements celebrated within the broader Stockholm startup ecosystem.
 





 • Launch new initiatives such as
 
**Fika Forum** 

 , the monthly one-on-one matching program.
 





 • Support the launch of new Growth minds locations by helping set up first events and core member-experience infrastructure.
 




  





**Communications responsibilities** 





 • Manage public channels including LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube, email, and the website.
 





 • Create written content, social posts, visual assets, testimonials, and short videos.
 





 • Publish a monthly member email.
 





 • Produce and edit Growth minds podcast episodes and prepare short social clips.
 





 • Maintain a consistent publishing cadence and keep all digital profiles polished.
 





 • Track engagement and refine tone, style, and frequency based on performance.
 




  





**Requirements (must-haves)** 





 • Strong organizational ability.
 





 • Comfortable in a fast-moving environment with high autonomy.
 





 • Strong writing and editing skills.
 





 • Proven event-planning experience.
 





 • Experience running multiple communication channels.
 





 • Comfortable with basic video editing (CapCut or similar).
 





 • Strong interpersonal skills with founders and executives.
 




  





**Additional strengths (nice to have)** 





 • Experience with membership communities, fellowships, or associations.
 





 • Experience with Notion, Squarespace, Mailchimp, Figma, etc.
 





 • Background in communications, content, community management, or marketing.
 




  





**Performance mandate** 





 • Increase member retention by 10 percent in year one.
 





 • Deliver consistently high-quality events across all formats.
 





 • Build reliable feedback loops and turn insights into improvements.
 





 • Establish organized, repeatable systems across member care and communication.
 





 • Support successful launches in new locations.
 




  





**Details** 





 Location: Huvudsta, Stockholm In-Office
 





 Reports to: COO (Graham Richardson)

title: Machine Vision Engineer
description:
**MACHINE VISION ENGINEER** 




  





 We have invented a solar cell technology that enables endless energy, Powerfoyle. Not only will it change the world, but it also means you will work with leading technology, science, and machines – all under the same roof in our urban factories. We are passionate about the potential of our technology to make products better and easier to use. We build the next generation of clean green industry and unite in the vision of touching the lives of a billion people.
 



  





**WHO WE ARE** 




 We are on an exciting journey to bring our groundbreaking solar cell technology to the world. Sprung out of the solid Swedish industrial heritage, we are now in the stage of industrializing at scale to create real, impactful change.
 



 A novel technology means that most of what we do has never been done before. It’s challenging to create something new, and at Exeger we embrace that challenge with grit and passion, because we know that what we do matters.
 



  





**WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?** 




 Our Software and Mechatronics team within the Industrialization department is now looking for its next stellar Machine Vision Engineer. We believe you like working independently in a fluid environment, in cooperation with colleagues from many different fields. You exercise sound judgement as well as initiative. You like making things work and are comfortable with discharging responsibility. Personality wise you are alert, inquisitive, positive, self-motivated, and entrepreneurial.
 



  





 We focus as much on personality/cultural fit as on your merits but know that you will have a better chance at succeeding in this role if you have experience from:
 



  




* Engineering degree in the field of Mechatronics, Software development or equivalent
* Experience with common machine vision libraries and/or tools such as Halcon, OpenCV, Cognex, etc.
* Experience integrating hardware from common machine vision and camera suppliers.
* Experience calibrating and verifying industrial machine vision systems.
* Experience selecting and integrating cameras, lenses, framegrabbers and lighting components.
* Professional fluency in written and spoken English



  





 If you also have any of the experiences below it is considered meriting:
 



  




* Familiar with volume manufacturing and industry
* Demonstrated experience developing machine vision applications for manufacturing industry
* Experience with higher level programming languages such as C#, Java, Python, etc.
* Experience with Experience with common machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch
* Experience with industrial communication protocols such as OPC-UA, ModBus, MQTT, etc.
* Experience with modern IIoT -concepts
* Experience with robotics and robot controllers such as ABB, Yaskawa, Staubli, etc.
* Project management



  





**WHAT YOU WILL DO** 




 You will join the Software and Mechatronics team within the Industrialization department that provides machines for manufacturing the unique Exeger material. Hands-on the department works with acquiring machines, modifying off-the shelf machinery, and developing tailormade machines, measurement devices and other technical solutions. As a Machine Vision engineer you will analyse, conceive, architect, design, implement, verify, deploy, and validate our vision applications.
 



 The exact definition of this role is flexible and can be adapted depending on your background and interests. Please note that this role requires on-site availability.
 



  





**EXEGERIANS** 




 At Exeger we are many things, innovators and industrialists, visionaries and doers. You'll team up with world leading experts continuously expanding the possible. We embrace differences and our behavior expectations support and boost the Employeeship which is all about acting curious, determined, responsible and being yourself.
 



 We are confident in our product and our ability to bring it to the world. By combining different perspectives and skills, we push the boundaries of science and technology while always focusing on the common goal and vision. Our success is based on a cross-functional collaboration, as we grow and learn from each other.
 



  





**WHAT NOW** 




 Please send your application via Exeger’s career page. If you do not have a resume at hand, you are welcome to apply with your LinkedIn-profile.
 



  





**THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS** 




 When you have applied, an automized confirmation e-mail will be sent to you. The hiring team will then review all applicants together. Then you will be invited for interviews together with hiring manager and/or team and talent partner. Cases or scenarios might be used during the process. Reference- and background check is mandatory.
 



  





**MORE ABOUT EXEGER & OUR CULTURE** 




 Exeger is a Swedish company with a unique solar cell technology that converts all forms of light into electrical energy. This material, Powerfoyle, is the world’s only fully customizable solar cell. With its superior design properties, it can be integrated seamlessly into any electronic device.
 



 Powerfoyle enhances every product it is integrated into with extended or even unlimited battery life, putting the power of cutting-edge solar cell technology directly in the hands of people. Exeger is leading the way to energy independence through more sustainable and user-friendly products.

title: HPC System Manager
description:
PDC is expanding its group of system administrators. We are looking for a new system manager to become an integral part of our System Operations team currently consisting of ten people, running PDC's computational and storage infrastructure.
 



  





*We warmly welcome your application !* 




  





**Job Description** 




  





 The work includes:
 



  





 Administration of the HPC and storage infrastructures and services, development of these services based on user needs and technological advances, and close interaction with the PDC application experts, users and suppliers of computing systems and software.
 



  





 PDC operates state-of-the-art computational and storage resources for a variety of scientific application domains, including mechanics, computational chemistry, life sciences and physics. The center currently operates the most powerful academic computer in Sweden, an HPE Cray EX with 1282 CPU nodes and 70 GPU nodes with just over 500 GPUs in total. Please see https://www.pdc.kth.se for more information.
 



  





 You will have good opportunities to attend courses and conferences.
 



  





**Qualifications** 




  





**Requirements** 




  




* An academic degree in computer/computing science or in an area that uses HPC calculations or equivalent experience/skills.
* Extensive experience using, deploying, and administrating large Linux-based systems and services, as well as experience operating large HPC systems, preferably in an academic/research environment.
* Excellent knowledge of Linux, standard programming and scripting languages.
* A good command of English. However, it is not necessary to be able to speak Swedish as PDC is an international environment and the work language is English.
* It is very important that you are able to work well independently as well as function effectively in a team.



  





**Preferred Qualifications** 




  




* Cluster management systems (e.g. HPCM, Xcat).
* Management of physical server infrastructure (e.g. IPMI, Redfish)
* HPC-specific APIs and technologies (e.g. Slurm, MPI, OpenMP, CUDA).
* Virtualisation (e.g. KVM, Libvirt)
* Container tools (e.g. Docker, Singularity/Apptainer, Podman, LXC).
* Cloud application and infrastructure platforms (e.g. OpenStack, OpenShift, Proxmox, Kubernetes).
* Storage systems and technologies (e.g. Lustre, TSM, Ceph, S3).
* Networking (High speed interconnects, TCP/IP, LAN, WAN).
* Open OnDemand, ThinLinc.
* Computer hall infrastructure.



  





 Great emphasis will be placed on personal skills.
 



  





 Trade union representatives
 



  





 Contact information to trade union representatives.
 



  





 To apply for the position
 



  





 Log into KTH's recruitment system in order to apply for this position. You are responsible to ensure that your application is complete according to the instructions in the ad.
 



  





 The application must include:
 



  




* CV including relevant professional experience and knowledge.
* A personal letter describing why the applicant is interested in this position.



  





 Your complete application must be received by KTH no later than the last day of application, midnight CET/CEST (Central European Time/Central European Summer Time).
 



  





**About The Employment** 




  





 The employment is valid until further notice (permanent post) according to agreement.
 



 The employment begins with a six-month probationary period.
 



  





 Other information
 



  





 Striving towards gender equality, diversity and equal conditions is both a question of quality for KTH and a given part of our values.
 



  





 For information about processing of personal data in the recruitment process.
 



  





 It may be the case that a position at KTH is classified as a security-sensitive role in accordance with the Protective Security Act (2018:585). If this applies to the specific position, a security clearance will be conducted for the applicant in accordance with the same law with the applicant's consent. In such cases, a prerequisite for employment is that the applicant is approved following the security clearance.
 



  





 We firmly decline all contact with staffing and recruitment agencies and job ad salespersons.
 



  





 Disclaimer:
 *In case of discrepancy between the Swedish original and the English translation of the job announcement, the Swedish version takes precedence*
